image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from California; born in San Francisco, San Francisco County, Calif., July 4, 1941; graduated from Carmel High School, Carmel-by-the-Sea, Calif., 1959; B.S., Willamette University, Salem, Oreg., 1963; attended Santa Clara University, Santa Clara, Calif.; attended the Monterey Institute of International Studies, Monterey, Calif.; United States Peace Corps, 1963-1965; staff, California state assembly; member of the Monterey County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1975-1980; chair, 1979; member of the California state assembly, 1980-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Leon Panetta, and reelected to the eleven succeeding Congresses (June 8, 1993-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016.

researchRecord.description: The papers of former Congressman Sam Farr have not yet been processed.

recordLocation.name: California State University, Monterey Bay Library

researchRecord.name: 1975-1976 and 1981-1982, 2 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Papers from when Sam Farr was a member, Monterey County, Calif., board of supervisors and a member of the California state assembly. The papers contain correspondence received regarding other author's legislation; Assembly Constitutional Revision consultant's files.

researchRecord.name: 1980-1981, 1.25 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Subject and miscellaneous files from when Sam Farr was a member of the California state assembly, consisting of petitions, 5% sampling, chronological files, invitations, and miscellaneous subject files on off-shore drilling.

researchRecord.name: 1980-1985, 8 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Subject and author's bill files from when Sam Farr was a member of the California state assembly.

researchRecord.name: 1981-1982, 2 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Subject files from when Sam Farr was a member of the California state assembly.

researchRecord.name: 1981-1986, 19 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: District office files from when Sam Farr was a member of the California state assembly including administrative files covering issues, such as state departments and agencies, constituents, legislative committees, county and city matters, speeches and news releases. Also correspondence with constituents and various local and national agencies concerning local issues.

researchRecord.name: 1986-1993, 7 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Author's bill files of Sam Farr that include members' resolutions (1991-1992), miscellaneous correspondence, general correspondence, and personnel recommendations (1986). Also included are two UCSC banana slug ties.
